definition: bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: Let bad luck come down on both the houses.
sentences.chinese: 讓壞運降臨到這兩個家庭吧。

sentences.english: Nothing happens by chance or by means of good or bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼事情是因爲好運或者壞運而發生的。

sentences.english: Behind bad luck comes good luck.
The bad luck will show up this month, so be careful for the fight with others.
sentences.chinese: 壞運將在這個月出現，所以要小心可能和別人爭吵。

sentences.english: Walking under a ladder will bring bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 從梯子下走過會帶來壞運。

sentences.english: What may appear as bad fortune may in fact be the door that is just waiting to be opened.
sentences.chinese: 看起來像壞運的可能像一扇門一樣正等着你打開。

sentences.english: Good luck rarely commands one's attention like bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 好運很少象壞運那樣引人注意。

definition: to let emotions affect one's decisions
sugar-coated bullets, term used by Mao (originally in 1949) to refer to corrupting bourgeois influences
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
extreme benevolence, utmost duty (idiom); meticulous virtue and attention to duty
a clever person may become the victim of his own ingenuity (idiom); cleverness may overreach itself/too smart for one's own good
pinyin: cong1 ming2 fan3 bei4 cong1 ming2 wu4

definition: bearer of ill luck/person with the evil eye/comet
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
